alert.note: Alert for East Baton Rouge; Northern Livingston (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 05 at 6:55PM CDT by NWS New Orleans
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Livingston and central East Baton Rouge Parishes through 730 PM CDT... At 654 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Greenwell Spring, or near Denham Springs. This storm was nearly stationary. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Baton Rouge, Denham Springs, Walker, Merrydale, Watson, Greenwell Spring and Brownfields. This includes Interstate 12 between mile markers 7 and 17. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
